summary.text: Amends the Second Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act to Meet Immediate Needs Arising From the Consequences of Hurricane Katrina, 2005 to repeal requirements concerning the use of the emergency procurement authority under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act and the increased micropurchase threshold with respect to procurements of property or services by executive agencies for use in support of Hurricane Katrina rescue and relief operations.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Amends the Second Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act to Meet Immediate Needs Arising From the Consequences of Hurricane Katrina, 2005 to repeal requirements concerning the use of the emergency procurement authority under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act and the increased micropurchase threshold with respect to procurements of property or services by executive agencies for use in support of Hurricane Katrina rescue and relief operations.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
